bioghist.p: Edward Burgett Welsh (1881-1968) was a graduate of Wooster University and attended Princeton Theological Seminary, receiving a D.D. degree. Welsh was the pastor at the First United Presbyterian Church in Toronto, Ohio, where he served from 1926 to 1939. He served in other churches in Ohio and Pennsylvania, including the First Presbyterian Church in Coraopolis, Pennsylvania. A historian of the Presbyterian church, Welsh was the author of Buckeye Presbyterianism.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Edward B. Welsh. Much of the material is research for Welsh's book Buckeye Presbyterianism. Materials include: typescripts and photocopies of drafts of Buckeye Presbyterianism, 1963-1968; correspondence related to Welsh's research on the Free Presbyterian Church, 1943-1954; an index file of notes on church history; maps of Ohio showing locations of churches and Presbyteries; floorplans for the library of the College of Wooster, 1960; blueprints of the Welsh Presbyterian Church, Philadelphia, 1926; and typed extracts of minutes of the General Assembly, 1793-1861. Church records include: marriage licenses, 1915-1951; Barkersville (Evans Creek) Presbyterian Church Session Minutes (1871-circa 1876), Membership Roll (1870s-1880s) and Baptismal register (c. 1871-1891); Linton Presbyterian Church Session Minutes (1835-1855); Session Minutes of the Presbyterian Church of Frankfort, Ohio (1851-1865); and the minister's license of R. B. Wilson from Cambridge, Ohio, 1902. The collection also includes several scrapbooks: two scrapbooks of "Photographs and Notes Illustrative of Pioneer Presbyterian History in America" compiled by Welsh (many of the photographs and descriptions are of churches in Pennsylvania and Delaware); a scrapbook of clippings (1877-1895) from the United Presbyterian, Wayne County Herald (Wooster, Ohio), and other papers; and a scrapbook of clippings from the Free Presbyterian and the Anti-Slavery Bugle, 1850-1855.
